senses.definition: the land The land is the country, as distinct from the city.
example: We flew over land and sea. [j33] At last the sailors sighted land
He turned the land surrounding his house into a beautiful garden. [j33] The land is very fertile around here. [j33] The station covers thousands of hectares of land
Australia is a beautiful land. [j33] He travelled for many years in foreign lands
We landed at one of the smaller islands to spend the night. [j33] Their flight has just landed
Our ball landed in the neighbour's yard. [j33] The kite landed in a tree. [j33] They spin the wheel and if the ball lands against your number, you win
I landed the boat on the beach and pulled it up on the sand. [j33] It was a real struggle to land the fish
She lives out west somewhere, on the land. [j33] The National Party traditionally draws its support from the land

senses.definition: ' If someone lapses into a certain state, they fall or drift into that state.
example: Nino had a lapse of concentration and drove off the road. [j33] I've been suffering from memory lapses lately. [j33] The error was just a lapse[bj4]she's normally very careful
There was a lapse of ten years before he married again. [j33] The disease flares up for a few months at a time, with long lapses in between. [j33] I took up swimming again after the winter lapse
The offer will lapse at the end of the year. [j33] I let my membership lapse. [j33] If your driver's licence has lapsed by more than two years, you have to take the test again
Vishal lapsed into unconsciousness. [j33] She lapsed into incoherence because she was so angry

He was lashed to within an inch of his life for stealing. b ' [cf2]verb [cf1]If someone lashes someone or lashes  into them, they criticise them very severely.  [cf2]Harry really lashed into Dieter for forgetting the appointment. [j33] The report lashes the government's handling of the situation

senses.ps: Who wants the last of the soup? [j33] The last of my exams is on Friday. (b) '
senses.definition: the last (a) The last of something is the part or the one that remains to the end.  If you are the last to do something, you do it after everyone else.
example: The last question was the hardest. [j33] I missed the last bus. [j33] That's the last time I try to help her! [j33] Louise was last to finish. [j33] Who wants the last chocolate? [j33] Put this one last
At last we're together again! [j33] So you've got here at last! [j33] I looked everywhere and at last I found it under the bed
Louise was the last to finish. [j33] I must have been the last in the department to hear about it
note: [j34] ... WORD FAMILY adjective[cf1] lasting It left a lasting impression on me.  We need a lasting solution to the problem.

senses.ps: Keiko latched onto me at the party[bj4]I couldn't get rid of her. (b) '
senses.definition: latch onto (a) If someone latches onto you, they become very keen to spend time in your company, although you find this rather irritating.  If you latch onto something, you understand it or become aware of it.
example: It has a bar which you move into a certain position to keep the gate shut and which you lift to open it
Rasha latched onto the problem very quickly
note: ... WORD FAMILY verb[cf1] latch Be sure and latch the gate behind you,  so the dog doesn't get out.

senses.definition: ' In formal language, late describes someone who has died.
example: I stayed up late watching TV. [j33] The restaurant is open from seven till late. [j33] Look, it's late and we're all tired
My late husband was very fond of his pipe. [j33] The late Fred Hollows was famous as an eye surgeon

definition: Lately means 'recently'.
example: I've been getting a lot of headaches lately. [j33] I haven't seen Joan lately[bj4]is she OK? [j33] I've only lately arrived in town

senses.definition: ' Later is the comparative form of late, and means 'more late'.
example: At first I didn't like him, but later we became friends. [j33] Later I came to realise she was right
She is always later than Marc

definition: Latitude is the position of a place north or south of the equator.  It is measured in degrees.
note: ... COMPARE [cf1]this with longitude.
example: Camooweal is at latitude twenty degrees south

senses.definition: ' In rather formal language, if two things or people are mentioned, you can subse~ quently refer to the second one as the latter.
example: I much prefer the latter plan

You can either withdraw your superannuation or reinvest it.  It's probably better to do the latter

definition: ' If you laugh, you make a sound in your throat which shows that you are happy or that you think something is funny.  People also sometimes laugh because they are nervous or to show scorn.
note: ... WORD FAMILY noun[cf1] laugh He's got a very silly laugh.  He gave a sarcastic laugh. [j35] adjective[cf1] laughable The idea is so crazy that it's laughable.[j35] noun[cf1] laughter We could hear the laughter of the audience.
example: She laughed with delight. [j33] The baby laughed when it saw me. [j33] The audience laughed at the clowns. [j33] Promise you won't laugh if I tell you? [j33] The other kids laughed at her accent

senses.definition: ' If someone launches a new product, they put it onto the market and hold a special promotion for it.
example: They launched a jet boat to rescue the fishermen. [j33] The new liner was launched by the premier's wife
We launched distress flares to signal our position. [j33] The new satellite is due to be launched next month
We're going to launch the new range of clothes in June
note: ... WORD FAMILY noun[cf1] launch The launch was delayed by bad weather.   They gave the new model a big launch.

definition: In formal language, if you say something is lawful, you mean that it is not against the law.  You are allowed to do it.
note: ... WORD FAMILY adverb[cf1] lawfully You cannot law~ fully refuse.
example: Such actions may be lawful, but they are utterly immoral. [j33] I was obstructed while going about my lawful business

lawn cemetery' [cf1]A lawn cemetery is a place where people are buried in plots that form part of a large lawn

senses.definition: leaf through' [cf1]If you leaf through a book, you turn over its pages quickly because you are looking for something or just reading bits of it.  If you say that you are going to turn over a new leaf, you mean that you intend to start behaving in a better or more acceptable way.
example: Deciduous trees lose their leaves in winter
Several leaves had been torn out of her diary
We'll need to put both leaves in the table to seat eight
I decided to turn over a new leaf and give up smoking
note: ... WORD FAMILY adjective[cf1] leafy (leafier, leafiest) We sat in the leafy shade of the fig tree.

definition: A lotion is a liquid that you put on your skin to clean, protect or heal it.
example: You should put on some suntan lotion before you go to the beach. [j33] Catherine uses a moisturising lotion every day

definition: A lottery is a gambling game where people buy tickets and win a money prize if the number on their ticket is chosen at random
example: Lotteries are often run by state governments to raise money for the state

definition: Lotto is another word for bingo
example: Some State governments also run a gambling game of similar nature, called Lotto, in which you bet on which sequence of numbered balls will be selected
